 Add 2 vials (2 x 100 mg) of labetalol (5 mg/mL) to the remaining 160 mL of sodium chloride
0.9% to create a solution of 1 mg/mL.
 Start at 40mL/hour to a maximum of 160 mL/hour.
 Titrate against BP – aim for BP of 140/100 mmHg.
• Once hypertensive crisis has resolved, switch to an oral preparation.
• Alternatively, if emergency use is needed on the way to a high care setting and an infusion is not possible:
